item.description:
"21" is based on a true story about some MIT whiz kids that go out to Vegas and make a fortune applying their intellect counting cards.

Click here for movie info.

This movie is free and open to the public courtesy of the Lecture Series Committee (LCS) at MIT. Ben Mezrich and Jeff Ma will be there for a short talk.

CAREFULLY READ THE DIRECTIONS ON HOW TO FIND BUILDING 26. If you don't, you run the risk of vanishing without a trace in the MIT labyrinth only to reappear 7 years later with a Ph.D. in astrophysics and a permanent case of Einstein bed head. Don’t let this happen to you! The PhD maybe, the haircut – NO! READ THE DIRECTIONS.

The movie thing at MIT is laid back. There is a concession stand with great popcorn, and you can bring in your own food. However, no alcohol, tobacco or firearms or “Astrophysics for Dummies” will be permitted in the room.

I’ll be there at 6:45 pm to save us some seats. I'll wait in the lobby till 6:55. I’ll send my cell number out a day before just in case you get lost in the labyrinth.
item.how_to_find_us: I'll be in the lobby till about 6:55. Then it's up to you.
item.name: 21 @ MIT - Free
